page.title: 11Farming around Montrose.
page.content: There are both{dairy and arable farms in the Montrose and Hillside area although the land is predominantly used for growing crops. Some farms also rear cattle for fattening. Crops grown in our area are barley, wheat, potatoes, turnips,raspberries carrots, rye, peas, beans, calabrese, kale, grass and{oil seed rape}which, as a recent crop, has changed the landscape to iclude bright yellow in an otherwise green patchwork. Economic factors have encouraged farmers to look to alternative crop types and markets. Farming does not employ many people most farms being run by their owners although seasonal work is available at berry, carrot, and {"tattie"}time. Tayock and Gilrivie Farms,owned by Roy Middleton, produce an average of 7,300 litres of milk per week. Some sheep are kept at Langley.
